message.content:
1. One hundred and twenty patients were involved in the study.
2. The patients were randomly divided into four groups.
3. Group 1 was given 5% potassium nitrate (KNO3).
4. Group 2 was treated with a gallium-aluminum-arsenide diode laser.
5. The diode laser used had a power of 62.2 J/cm2.
6. The wavelength of the diode laser used was 980 nm.
7. The diode laser was used in a noncontact pulse mode.
8. The power wattage of the diode laser was 0.5 W.
9. Group 3 was treated with a combination of 5% KNO3 and the diode laser.
10. Group 4 was the control group and was given a placebo.

messages.content:
Statement: One hundred and twenty patients were randomly divided into four groups: (i) Group 1-5% potassium nitrate (KNO3); (ii) Group 2 - gallium-aluminum-arsenide diode laser (62.2 J/cm2, wavelength - 980 nm, noncontact pulse mode, and power wattage - 0.5 W); (iii) Group 3 - combined 5% KNO3 and the diode laser; and (iv) Group 4 - placebo (control).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
